intro: Citharexylum alainii, commonly known as the Alain's citharexylum, is a flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters and blooming during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
